text: you can create a CSS class that wraps your CTAs that has a minimum height of what the cta is.

Thanks! This is what I have been thinking of doing - just need to relay the instructions to the content editors. :slightly_smiling_face: It’s too bad custom css classes can’t be added to the RichText WYSIWYG, but I’m sure I can get these guys to go into their articles and add the right class.
You can add html in the rich text editors. You an click code and add a div with a class..

Does anyone know if there is a way to edit the min.main.js file? I am running into a syntax error on that HubSpot built file which is causing my module to crash. I am able to access the main.js file from the design tools in HubSpot BUT that file doesn’t have the syntax error, only the minified file does.
So you have the `main.js` file in the file system but the `main.min.js` file has a syntax error?

yeah! you can see the error on this page <https://home.hippoed.com/-temporary-slug-3e9f0a64-a30a-46c3-9c51-f54f0ac368bc?hs_preview=jGwcCzlS-38429249416|here>. I think its caused by the very last line having two backslashes as a comment rather than forward slashes
I can fix this pretty quick
YES! thank you so much!!! I’ve been driving myself crazy over this for a few days! :joy:

Thanks for the report, just testing the fix in QA now. Once it is out in prod, you should be able to publish a small change to the JS file in the design manager and it will re-minify the file for you. I will let you know when to do that soon
Ok the fix to the minifier should be out now. Can you try reuploading a new version of the file (with a slight change like an additional space somewhere)
I would usually edit in the UI but looks like the file exceeds the maximum size for the editor
YESSSS!!!! that fixed it!!!!! THANK YOU! I’m so appreciative. thank you for the really quick fix too!! :ty::raised_hands:
